inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: positive serum MPO-ANCA in medical record

inclusion.criterion: Inflammatory sinusitis with histopathological evidence of granulomatous inflammation
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Pulmonary nodule or infiltrates in a patient in the absence of infection
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: bilateral multiple infiltrates in the upper lobes

inclusion.criterion: Evidence of active disease as defined by a Vasculitis Disease Activity Index of greater than or equal to 3
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Birmingham Vasculitis Activity Score (BVAS) is above 4

exclusion.criterion: Evidence of infection by gram stain and/or culture specimens
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Recent (within four weeks) increase in GC or cytotoxic drug therapy
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients who are pregnant or nursing infants will not be eligible
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Processes that would predispose to enhanced risk of MTX toxicity: acute or chronic liver disease, alcohol abuse (greater than 14 oz of 100 proof liquor or equivalent per week), active peptic ulcer disease, and inability to comply with study guidelines
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Serological evidence of infection with human immunodeficiency virus
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a 57-year-old man with Wegener's granulomatosis, positive serum MPO-ANCA, and bilateral multiple infiltrates in the upper lobes. He has been treating with corticosteroid and cyclophosphamides for 4 months.
